legendaryGroup.name: The Gates of Hades
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Cerberus can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Cerberus can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Ethereal Chains:} Each creature within the lair must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn.

{@b Soul Siphon:} Each creature within 60 feet of Cerberus must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take ({@dice 2d8}) necrotic damage. Cerberus gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the total damage dealt. Undead and constructs are unaffected by this effect.
{@b Veil of Shadows:} Magical darkness spreads from Cerberus to cover a 60-foot radius, lasting until the next initiative count 20. This darkness can't be dispelled.

regionalEffects: The Gates of Hades are influenced by Cerberus' presence:

items: {@b Whispers of the Dead:} Faint, unintelligible whispers can be heard at all times, disorienting creatures and imposing them disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. Cerberus is unaffected by this effect.
{@b Spectral Fog:} A ghostly fog clings to the ground, reducing visibility and making the terrain diffcult to navigate.
{@b Ethereal Cold:} A chilling cold pervades the area, a reminder of the proximity to death and the afterlife.

legendaryGroup.name: Chimera's Lair
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the chimera can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the chimera can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Molten Spill:} Molten rock bubbles up in a 10-foot radius at a point on the ground the chimera can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take ({@dice 2d10}) fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. The area becomes diffcult terrain until the next initiative count 20.

{@b Cave Collapse:} Rocks and debris fall from the ceiling in a 20-foot radius centered on a point of the chimera's choice in the lair. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@dice 3d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also knocked {@condition prone}.

{@b Serpentine Mist:} The chimera releases a hissing, serpentlike mist in a 30-foot radius around it. The area becomes heavily obscured, and each creature that starts its turn in the mist must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. The mist lasts until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: The area surrounding the lair is warped by the ancient chimera's magic:

items: {@b Fearsome Roars:} Occasional roars and growls echo through the area, audible up to 3 miles away. These sounds can unsettle wildlife and travelers.
{@b Twisted Flora:} Plants within 1 mile of the lair grow in bizarre and twisted shapes, some resembling the chimera's heads or parts of its body, creating an eerie and unsettling landscape.

{@b Sulfurous Fumes:} Pockets of sulfurous gas are common within 1 mile of the lair. These fumes can suddenly erupt from the ground, creating small areas of poisonous gas that linger for a few minutes before dissipating.

regionalEffects: If the chimera dies, these effects fade over the next week.

legendaryGroup.name: The Labyrinth of the Minotaur
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Minotaur can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Minotaur can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Maze of Shadows:} The walls of the Labyrinth shift, rearranging its layout. Each creature within the lair must succeed on a {@dc  15} Intelligence saving throw or become lost, suffering the effects of the confusion spell until the end of its next turn.

{@b Echoing Roar:} The Minotaur lets out a bellowing roar that reverberates through the labyrinth. Each creature within 120 feet of the Minotaur must succeed on a {@dc  15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

{@b Labyrinthine Illusions:} Illusory walls and creatures spring up within the labyrinth. For the next minute, the labyrinth is filled with deceptive mirages, imposing a -5 modifier to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Intelligence (Investigation) checks to navigate the maze.

regionalEffects: The presence of the Minotaur influences the Labyrinth and the surrounding region:

items: {@b Whispers of the Lost:} Soft whispers and footfalls fill the air, seemingly coming from just around the corner, disorienting intruders and imposing disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to navigate the maze.
{@b Ominous Tremors:} The ground within and around the labyrinth occasionally trembles, as if reacting to the Minotaur's movements, creating a sense of unease and alertness.

{@b Shifting Passages:} The very structure of the labyrinth seems to change and adapt, making maps and memorized paths unreliable. Even experienced navigators find themselves second-guessing their choices and direction.

regionalEffects: If the Minotaur dies, these effects end immediately.

legendaryGroup.name: The Sanctum of the Depths
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Triton takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Triton can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Abyssal Surge:} The water pressure in the lair intensifies. Each creature within the lair must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in a direction of Triton's choice and take 3d8 bludgeoning damage.
{@b Call of the Depths:} Triton summons 1d4 + 1 water hippocampi. These elementals are friendly to Triton and act on their own initiative, but they disappear at the next initiative count 20.

{@b Enchantment of the Abyss:} Strange currents disrupt the minds of intruders. Each creature of Triton's choice within the lair must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: The Sanctum of the Depths is a place where the forces of the ocean and arcane intertwine:

items: {@b Eternal Tide:} The water within the sanctum ebbs and flows rhythmically, creating a perpetual, calming tide that can mesmerize those who linger too long.
{@b Bioluminescent Aura:} The walls and creatures within the sanctum emit a soft, bioluminescent glow, providing dim light in the chambers.
{@b Resonance of the Abyss:} The walls of the sanctum resonate with the echoes of ancient spells and mystical incantations, creating an aura of magical potency.

regionalEffects: If Triton dies, these effects gradually fade over the course of 7 days, returning the sanctum to the natural order of the ocean depths.

legendaryGroup.name: Tartarus
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Typhon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Typhon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Magma Surge:} Magma erupts from the ground in a 30- foot radius centered on a point Typhon can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Winds of Chaos:} Violent winds sweep through the area within 120 feet of Typhon. Each creature there must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from Typhon and knocked {@condition prone}.

{@b Eyes of Annihilation:} Typhon's eyes glow with an eldritch light that pierces reality itself. He targets one creature he can see within 120 feet. The chosen creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw or be banished to a demiplane of endless torment. To escape, the creature must use its action to make a Charisma check contested by Typhon's. If the creature wins, it escapes the dream plane. Otherwise, the effect ends on initiative count 20 on the next round. When the effect ends, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that one is occupied.

regionalEffects: The influence of Typhon and the essence of Tartarus extend beyond its physical boundaries, warping the surrounding environment with its malevolent aura. The regional effects of Tartarus manifest as the maddening energies of the abyss seep into the world:

items: {@b Cacophonic Whispers:} Faint echoes of suffering and madness can be heard carried by the wind, imposing disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing within Tartarus.
{@b Chaos-touched Ground:} The land within Tartarus is unstable, with the earth trembling underfoot, imposing disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.
{@b Nightmarish Shadows:} Shadows cast within Tartarus occasionally twist and writhe as if alive, causing unease.

{@b Monstrous Manifestations:} Creatures native to Tartarus, or those with chaotic origins, gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that would charm or frighten them within Tartarus.

{@b Dark Resonance:} Spells that deal psychic damage or create illusions are heightened in potency within Tartarus, causing creatures affected by these spells to take maximum psychic damage or have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws to detect illusions.

regionalEffects: If Typhon dies, these effects end over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Azure Dragon's Lair
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Azure Dragon takes a lair action to enact one of the following effects. The Azure Dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Radiant Burst:} A burst of radiant energy erupts from above, encompassing a 10-foot radius centered on a point the dragon can perceive within 120 feet. Creatures within the area must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or take 49 (14d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Mystic Gust:} The air currents within the lair become a tempest of arcane power. Each creature within 120 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet in a direction of the dragon's choice and knocked {@condition prone} by the gusts.

{@b Gaze of Revelation:} The dragon's eyes emit a piercing light that reveals the truths hidden within reality. It targets one creature within 120 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to a momentary glimpse of cosmic understanding, being {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn as it grapples with the profound insights unveiled by the dragon's gaze.

regionalEffects: The presence of the Azure Dragon infuses its lair with a mystic ambiance that transcends mere physical boundaries. The region surrounding the lair becomes suffused with its enigmatic energy, causing the environment to shift and waver in response:

items: {@b Ethereal Whispers:} Faint whispers of ancient knowledge drift upon the wind, granting advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks within the lair.

{@b Harmonious Nexus:} The very ground resonates with an attuned harmony, providing allies advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} while within the lair.
{@b Astral Illumination:} The lair is naturally lit with enchanting illumination, casting mystical and mesmerizing patterns of light that dance across surfaces.

{@b Mystic Reflections:} Spells that manipulate light or create illusions are heightened in the presence of the Azure Dragon, causing illusions to become more convincing. Creatures hostile to the dragon have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws to detect illusions.
{@b Cosmic Presence:} Allies within the lair gain resistance to radiant damage and advantage on saving throws against being blinded or {@condition restrained}.

legendaryGroup.name: Garuda's Aerie
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Garuda takes a lair action to enact one of the following effects. Garuda can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Aerial Radiance:} The aerie's radiant energies coalesce, bathing the area in a soothing, heavenly wind. Creatures of Garuda's choice within 120 feet of Garuda regain 20 hit points at the start of their next turn.

{@b Celestial Wind:} Garuda's cry resonates through the aerie summoning a celestial wind. Each creature within 90 feet of Garuda must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by a celestial wind until the end of their next turn.

{@b Wind's Embrace:} Garuda summons a gust of wind to envelop a 20-foot radius centered on a point it can perceive within 120 feet. Creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from Garuda and knocked {@condition prone}.

regionalEffects: The presence of Garuda imbues its aerie with an otherworldly ambiance that extends to the surrounding region withing 10 miles of its lair:

items: {@b Windy:} A powerful wind blows, making acrobatic maneuvers in the area more challenging, imposing disadvantage on all Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.
{@b Whispers of the Wind:} Gentle breezes carry echoes of ancient wisdom, granting advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks within Garuda's aerie.
{@b Heavenly Serenity:} Allies within the aerie have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
{@b Eagle's Insight:} Spells related to divination or insight are heightened in Garuda's presence, granting creatures advantage on related ability checks and saving throws.

legendaryGroup.name: Naraka's Abyss
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Naraka takes a lair action to enact one of the following effects. Naraka can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Abyssal Flames:} Pockets of the abyss erupt with ghostly blue flames. Each creature within a 30-foot radius of a point Naraka can perceive within the lair must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 35 (10d6) fire damage and become cursed. While cursed in this way, the creature has its speed halved, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed. The curse lasts until the next initiative count 20 or until removed by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

{@b Chains of Torment:} Naraka summons ethereal chains from the ground. The chains target up to three creatures within 60 feet of Naraka. The targeted creatures must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, freeing itself on a success.

{@b Shadows' Embrace:} Naraka draws shadows from the abyss to cloak an area in darkness. He chooses a point he can perceive within 90 feet and engulfs a 40-foot radius around it in magical darkness. The darkness lasts until until initiative count 20 on the next round or until dispelled by a daylight spell.

regionalEffects: Naraka's malevolent influence extends from his abyssal lair, casting a pall over the surrounding region within 10 miles of his realm:

items: {@b Chained Ground:} Chains sporadically emerge from the ground, hindering movement. The region surrounding the lair is difficult terrain for every creature other than Naraka.

{@b Despairing Fog:} A thick, miasmic fog blankets the region. This fog plays tricks on the mind, causing those who navigate through it to occasionally see fleeting images of their worst fears or regrets. For every hour spent within the fog, a creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or gain a level of exhaustion from mental fatigue.
{@b Eternal Night:} The region is shrouded in perpetual darkness. Natural light or sunlight can't pierce this darkness, obscuring the area in an eternal night.

legendaryGroup.name: Frostfang Den
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Fenrir takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Fenrir can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Binding Shadows:} Shadows within the lair animate and attempt to bind the creatures. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the next initiative count 20.

{@b Howl of Despair:} A chilling howl reverberates through the lair, striking fear into the hearts of intruders. All creatures within the lair must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the next initiative count 20.

{@b Eyes of the Predator:} Fenrir's gaze fixates on one target it can see within the lair, filling them with dread. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} with fear until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding Frostfang Den is tainted by the wolf's menacing and malevolent aura.

items: {@b Twisted Flora:} The vegetation within 10 miles of Frostfang Den becomes twisted and thick, hindering movement and creating an eerie, unsettling atmosphere.
{@b Endless Night:} An unnatural, perpetual night hangs over the area within 10 miles of the lair.
{@b Beasts' Agitation:} Animals within 5 miles of the lair are restless and aggressive, often attacking travelers without provocation.
{@b Whispers of the Forest:} Faint whispers can be heard within 3 miles of Frostfang Den, sowing discord and confusion among those who enter.
{@b Unseen Pathways:} The surrounding forest magically shifts and changes over time, causing disorientation and making it easy for creatures to get lost.

regionalEffects: If Fenrir dies, these effects end over the course of 24 hours.

legendaryGroup.name: Helheim, the Realm of the Dead
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Hel takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Hel can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Cold Grasp:} The temperature in the lair suddenly drops. Each creature within the lair must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 18 (4d8) cold damage and have their speed reduced by 10 feet until the next initiative count 20.

{@b Specter's Call:} Hel summons 1d4 + 1 spirits of the restless dead. These spirits use the statistics of a spirit of helheim and are under Hel's control. They disappear at the next initiative count 20.

{@b Whispers of Despair:} Melancholic whispers pervade the space, sapping the will of the living. Each creature in the lair must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: Helheim is a realm of somber and deathly powers:

items: {@b Endless Night:} The sky over Helheim is perpetually shrouded in a twilight gloom, with neither sunlight or moonlight able to pierce through its eternal darkness.
{@b Chill of the Grave:} The air in Helheim is thick with an unnerving, deathly cold that penetrates to the bone.

{@b Silence of Death:} An absolute, almost oppressive silence pervades Helheim. Within the realm, sounds are strangely muted, and the natural noises of the environment are eerily absent, contributing to create an unsettling atmosphere.

{@b Distorted Reality:} Helheim seems frozen in time. Trees and plants appear lifeless, and there's a pervasive sense of stillness and stagnation, as though the entire realm is held in a timeless, deathly grip.

legendaryGroup.name: The Abyssal Depths
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Jormungandr takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Jormungandr can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Tidal Surge:} Water within the lair surges and swells. Each creature within the lair other than Jormungandr must make a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and pushed up to 15 feet in a direction of Jormungandr's choice.

{@b Venomous Mist:} A cloud of poisonous mist fills a 20-footradius sphere centered on a point Jormungandr can see within 60 feet of it until the next initiative count 20. The area is heavily obscured. Each creature that start its turn within the cloud must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

{@b Ancient Echoes:} Whispers of ancient prophecies fill the air, causing creatures within the lair to be overwhelmed by a sense of dread and confusion. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding Jormungandr's lair is permanently warped by its ancient and malevolent presence.

items: {@b Perpetual Storms:} The ocean surface above the lair is eternally stormy, with thunderstorms, strong winds, and treacherous waves making navigation nearly impossible.
{@b Sea of Despair:} Creatures within 6 miles of the lair often experience feelings of hopelessness and existential dread, affecting their morale and decision-making.
{@b Ocean's Whispers:} Haunting, sibilant whispers can be faintly heard by creatures within 1 mile of the lair, causing nightmares and disturbing visions.
{@b Unnatural Currents:} Water currents near the lair are unpredictable and strong, making swimming and navigation difficult for unprepared travelers.
{@b Deep Pressure:} The pressure of the deep water near the lair has unusual effects on magic, potentially altering the effects or duration of spells cast within the region at the GM's discretion.

regionalEffects: If Jormungandr dies, these effects end over the course of 24 hours.

legendaryGroup.name: Lindworm's Lair
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the lindworm takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the lindworm can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@b Acidic Drips:} Acid drips from the ceiling in a 20-foot radius circle centered on a point the lindworm can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) acid damage.

{@b Toxic Mists:} Swirling toxic mists fill a 60-foot radius sphere centered on a point the lindworm chooses within 120 feet of it until the next initiative count 20. The sphere spreads around corners, and thea area is heavily obscured. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Eroding Terrain:} The lindworm targets one 30-foot radius section of floor or wall within 120 feet of it. That section erodes and becomes difficult terrain for every

lairActions: Lair actions represent the powerful and mystical influence that a creature exerts over its domain, shaping and altering the environment with its potent magical essence. It is suggested for lair actions to be reserved for more mature and powerful lindworms to emphasize their formidable presence and the majestic control they maintain over their territories. We would recommend introducing lair actions from the Adult or Elder stage of a lindworm's lifecycle onwards. This decision should be made considering the thematic impact and the challenge you wish to present to your players. Adjusting the potency of lair actions can greatly influence the atmosphere of the encounter and the overall narrative significance of lindworms within your campaign. We suggest using the following DCs for Lair Actions, depending on the specific Lindworm's age:
regionalEffects: The region containing the lindworm's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates the following effects:

items: {@b Venomous Wildlife:} Snakes, spiders, and other venomous creatures are drawn to the area and are unusually aggressive. Such creatures act as the lindworm's eyes and ears, alerting it to the presence of intruders.

{@b Corrosive Atmosphere:} Bodies of water within 6 miles of the lair are mildly acidic, causing creatures that drink from them to suffer minor discomfort and a bitter taste. Plants in the area grow in bizarre, twisted shapes and are often covered with thorns.
{@b Rocky Tremors:} Tremors occasionally shake the ground within 6 miles of the lindworm's lair, causing small rockslides and making climbing more challenging.

regionalEffects: If the lindworm dies, these effects fade over the course of 7 days.

legendaryGroup.name: The Roots of Yggdrasil
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Nidhogg takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Nidhogg can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Venomous Eruption:} Pools of venom spontaneously burst from the ground. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius of a point of Nidhogg's choice must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 (4d8) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the next initiative count 20.

{@b Roar of Desolation:} Nidhogg unleashes a powerful roar that echoes throughout the lair. Each creature within the lair must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened}, until the next initiative count 20.

{@b Shadow's Grasp:} Shadows within the lair animate and reach out to entangle creatures. Each creature of Nidhogg's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: Nidhogg's influence distorts the environment surrounding its lair:

items: {@b Perpetual Cold:} An unnatural cold pervades the region within 6 miles of the lair, subjecting creatures to the effects of extreme cold.
{@b Twisted Flora:} Within 1 mile of the lair, vegetation becomes monstrous and aggressive, roots and branches attempting to ensnare and harm those who traverse the area.

{@b Shadows of Unrest:} Shadows within 1 mile of the lair seem to dance and flicker erratically, creating an atmosphere of unease and paranoia, and whispers of malcontent pervade the frosty air, often sowing discord and fear.
{@b Icy Mists:} Vision-obscuring, icy mists persist within 1 mile of the lair, making the terrain difficult to navigate and shrouding the lair's entrance in mystery and foreboding.

regionalEffects: If Nidhogg dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 2d10} days, allowing the surrounding environment to slowly heal from the dragon's corruptive influence.

legendaryGroup.name: Camazotz's Cavern
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Camazotz takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. It can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Echoing Screech:} The cavern amplifies Camazotz's chilling screech, disorienting its foes. Each creature within 60 feet of a point Camazotz can see within the lair must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be deafened and {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

{@b Shadowy Grasp:} Shadows within the cavern come alive, reaching out to grasp creatures within. Each creature within 30 feet of Camazotz other than it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the shadows until the next initiative count 20.
{@b Bats' Assistance:} A {@creature swarm of bats|MM} is summoned to assist Camazotz, acting on its own initiative and following Camazotz's commands.

regionalEffects: The region within 5 miles of Camazotz's cavern is influenced by its dark presence.

items: {@b Eternal Twilight:} The area is perpetually dim, even during daylight hours, as if twilight has cast its permanent, somber hue across the land.
{@b Disquieting Echoes:} Unsettling sounds and distant screeches frequently ripple through the air, making it difficult for creatures to discern the origin of noises.
{@b Bat Dominance:} Bats are found in abundance, and they are more aggressive than usual, often swarming intruders or those who venture too close to the cavern.

legendaryGroup.name: Temple of the Feathered Serpent
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Quetzalcoatl takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Quetzalcoatl can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Wave of Enlightenment:} Quetzalcoatl emanates a burst of illuminating energy within a 120-foot radius. Each creature in this area other than Quetzalcoatl must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} by profound knowledge until the end of its next turn.

{@b Sacred Wind:} A gust of divine wind sweeps through the temple. Each creature other than Quetzalcoatl within 120 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from him and knocked {@condition prone}.

{@b Call of the Precious Twin:} The essence of Quetzalcoatl's brother, Xolotl, flickers in the lair, casting shadows and whispers that disorient foes. Each creatures of Quetzalcoatl's choice within 120 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be confused as per the confusion spell until the end of its next turn.

regionalEffects: The region containing the Temple of the Feathered Serpent is transformed by Quetzalcoatl's godly presence.

items: {@b Radiant Dawn:} The lair is perpetually bathed in the soft, golden glow of dawn, illuminating the area with a warm and comforting light that facilitates concentration and meditation. Allies within the temple have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks.

{@b Breath of Knowledge:} Whispers of ancient wisdom float through the air, granting those who listen insight and understanding. Allies within the temple have advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws.
{@b Blessing of the Feathered Serpent:} Quetzalcoatl's protective aura covers the temple. Allies within the temple other than Quetzalcoatl gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws.

{@b Harmony of Elements:} The lair has a harmonious balance of the elemental forces, fostering life and tranquility. The area within 6 miles of the lair is immune to extreme weather conditions, and crops are exceptionally bountiful.

legendaryGroup.name: Supay's Lair - Ukhu Pacha
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Supay takes a lair action to manifest one of the following effects. Supay can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Realm of Shadows:} The darkness within the lair deepens. The area becomes heavily obscured, and all non-devil creatures can't see further than 5 feet away until initiative count 20 on the next round.

{@b Abyssal Chains:} Shadowy chains burst from the ground, attempting to bind creatures. Every creature that Supay can see within 60 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. A restrained target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

{@b Mass Soul Drain:} Supay siphons life force from intruders. Each creature within 60 feet of Supay must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Supay regains hit points

regionalEffects: Supay's influence pervades the Ukhu Pacha.

items: {@b Eternal Twilight:} The realm is shrouded in an eternal twilight, bathed in a mysterious, subdued glow. Nonmagical light sources are weakened, able to cast only dim light with a maximum radius of 30 feet.
{@b Whispers of the Departed:} Faint echoes of lost souls linger, imparting a sense of unease. All Charisma ability checks and saving throws made by non-devil creatures are made at disadvantage.

{@b Shifting Realities:} The boundaries between planes blur, leading to unpredictable occurrences. Teleportation and planar travel are unreliable. Any time a creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave Ukhu Pacha, it must first make a {@dc 18} Intelligence check. On a success, the creature can use that magic to exit the region. On a failure, the creature can't exit Ukhu Pacha and wastes the use of the spell or effect.

regionalEffects: If Supay dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 weeks.

legendaryGroup.name: The Underworld
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Xolotl takes a lair action to enact one of the following effects. Xolotl cannot use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Soul's Radiance:} Xolotl summons a radiant burst of ancestral energy from a point within 120 feet that he can perceive. Creatures within a 10-foot radius of this point must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) radiant damage, taking half damage on a successful save.

{@b Ancestral Whispers:} Whispering voices fill the lair, disorienting enemies. Each creature other than Xolotl within 120 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become confused, as per the confusion spell, until the end of its next turn.

{@b Twilight Veil:} Shadows coalesce around one creature within 120 feet that Xolotl can see. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or become engulfed in shadows, becoming blinded and {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn.

regionalEffects: The Underworld pulsates with the mystical essence of Xolotl, causing shifts and alterations within the environment.

items: {@b Shadowy Echoes:} Whispers of the dead provide guidance, granting advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks within the Underworld.
{@b Eternal Twilight:} The environment is suffused with a permanent soft, shadowy light, providing dim illumination throughout the lair.
{@b Spiritual Guidance:} Allies within the Underworld have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

{@b Illusory Shadows:} The shadows in the Underworld are particularly deceptive. Enemies of Xolotl have disadvantage on saving throws to see through illusions and to perceive {@condition invisible} creatures.

legendaryGroup.name: The Hall of Truth
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Anubis takes a lair action to exert control over the realm of the dead, manifesting one of the following effects:

items: {@b Judgment of the Dead:} Anubis causes spectral scales to appear and weigh the hearts of those present. Each creature of Anubis' choice within 60 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn due to overwhelming guilt.

{@b Veil of Shadows:} The Hall of Truth becomes shrouded in darkness. The area within 120 feet of Anubis is filled with magical darkness until the next inititiave count 20. Creatures within this darkness other than Anubis have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

{@b Summon Guardians:} Anubis summons 1d4 + 1 {@creature anubis jackal|MythologicalCreatures} in a point he can see within 120 ft of him. These creatures action their own initiative and obey Anubis' commands.

regionalEffects: The region around the Hall of Truth, extending up to 10 miles, is influenced by Anubis' divine presence:

items: {@b Eternal Rest:} The spirits of the dead are calmer and less likely to haunt or trouble the living.
{@b Sacred Ground:} The land becomes hallowed, repelling undead creatures and preventing them from entering or being created within the area.
{@b Whispers of the Dead:} Occasionally, the living can hear faint whispers or gain cryptic visions from the spirits, possibly offering guidance or warnings.

{@b Final Judgment:} Creatures within this region might feel a sense of being watched or judged and have disadvantage on Deception (Charisma) saving throws, leading to more honest and introspective behaviours.

legendaryGroup.name: The Temple of Crocodiles
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Sobek takes a lair action to call upon the powers of the Nile, manifesting one of the following effects:

items: {@b Flood of the Nile:} The temple's floor floods with water from the Nile. The area within 120 feet of Sobek becomes difficult terrain, and each creature must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet in a direction of Sobek's choice.
{@b Blessing of Fertility:} The temple's waters surge with lifegiving energy. Allies of Sobek within 60 feet regain 20 hit points and advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw.

{@b Crocodile Swarm:} Sobek summons 1d4 + 1 {@creature sobek crocodile|MythologicalCreatures} at a point he can see within 120 feet of him. The crocodiles act on their own initiative and obey Sobek's commands.

regionalEffects: The region around Sobek's temple, extending up to 10 miles, is influenced by his divine presence:

items: {@b Calm Waters:} The Nile's currents within this region are gentle, safeguarding those who travel upon its waters.
{@b Crocodile's Favor:} Crocodiles and other river creatures within this region are less aggressive towards allies of Sobek and may even assist them in times of need.
{@b Fertile Lands:} Crops within this region grow abundantly, providing a bountiful harvest.
{@b Sacred Ground:} The land around Sobek's lair is consecrated, imbued with a divine essence. Hieroglyphs of crocodiles and other symbols of Sobek appear on rocks and trees.

legendaryGroup.name: Wadjet's Sanctum
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Wadjet takes a lair action to call upon the divine energies of her sanctum, choosing from one of the following effects:

items: {@b Sacred Asp:} The statues of cobras lining the sanctum come to life, striking at Wadjet's foes. Each enemy within 30 feet of a cobra statue must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Nile's Blessing:} The waters within the sanctum surge with life-giving energies. Wadjet and her allies within 60 feet of her regain 20 hit points and are freed from any poison, curse, or disease affecting them.

{@b Protector's Gaze:} The eyes of Wadjet's statues emit a radiant glow. Each creature of Wadjet's choice that she can see within 120 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: Wadjet's divine presence weaves through the desert lands surrounding her sanctum, extending her protection in a radius of 10 miles:

items: {@b Sands of Time:} Sand in the region shifts to reveal ancient relics and secrets, giving advantage on Wisdom (Survival) and Intelligence (History) checks to find or interpret them.
{@b Oasis Mirage:} Illusory oases appear throughout the desert. While they do not provide sustenance, they can offer respite from the heat and a place to rest.
{@b Serpent's Whisper:} Serpents and other creatures in the region are allies of Wadjet, and they watch over her domain. They will not harm those who show reverence to Wadjet.
{@b Desert's Wrath:} Sandstorms in the region are more intense but part ways for those who utter a prayer to Wadjet, providing them safe passage.

legendaryGroup.name: Progenitus' Domain
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Progenitus takes a monstrous action to cause one of the following effects. Progenitus can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: {@b Aetherial Storm:} A storm of chaotic energy forms in a 40- foot radius centered on a point Progenitus can see within 150 feet. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The storm disrupts magic, dispelling spells of 3rd level or lower in the area as per the dispel magic spell.

{@b Creation's Call:} Progenitus emits a powerful roar that resonates with the essence of creation, compelling its monstrous offspring within 1000 feet to converge towards it. Each monstrosity that hears the call must immediately expend its reaction (if available) to move up to its speed towards Progenitus without provoking opportunity attacks.
{@b Monstrous Adaptation:} Progenitus adapts, rolling once on the {@table Progenitus Creature Adaptations|MythologicalCreatures} Table. The effect lasts until the next initiative count 20.

regionalEffects: The area surrounding Progenitus is marked by its profound influence on the ecosystem and reality itself. The regional effects of Progenitus's lair include:

items: {@b Adaptive Genesis:} Any monstrosity that is summoned, spawned, or enters the area within 10 miles of Progenitus for the first time must roll once on the {@table Progenitus Creature Adaptations|MythologicalCreatures} Table.

{@b Primal Weather:} The weather within 10 miles of Progenitus is subject to sudden and severe changes, influenced by its chaotic energy. Clear skies may abruptly give way to tempestuous storms, and calm nights can suddenly be lit by auroras of unnatural colors. These weather patterns can change without warning, occurring within minutes and lasting for hours or days.
{@b Veil of Mists:} Thick, unnatural mists blanket the land within 5 miles of Progenitus. These mists distort perceptions and obscure sight, imposing disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

{@b Emanations of Vitality:} Plants and natural features within 10 miles of Progenitus grow with unnerving vigor and sometimes manifest monstrous traits. Trees might have bark that resembles scales, and flowers could bloom with eyes that follow movement.

trait.name: Spike Regrowth
entries: The aeternae has twelve spikes. Used spikes regrow when the Aeternae finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Spiked Defense
entries: When a creature hits the aeternae with a melee attack, the attacker takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage from the aeternae's spikes. Any creature grappling the aeternae also takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aeternae makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its spikes, or two with its spikes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spike Launch
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or lose 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a magic wound. Each time the aeternae hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 3 ({@dice 1d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

trait.name: Dual Nature
entries: The amphisbaena has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The amphisbaena has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The amphisbaena regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the amphisbaena takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the amphisbaena's next turn. The amphisbaena dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Underground Camouflage
entries: The amphisbaena has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in underground environments and while burrowed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The amphisbaena makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Venomous Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The amphisbaena exhales a 30-foot cone of poisonous gas. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The amphisbaena makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The amphisbaena moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The amphisbaena makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Ancient Hydra

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Legendary Resistances (3/Day)
entries: If the hydra fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Multi-Headed
entries: The hydra has nine heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

Whenever the hydra takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. When a head dies, the hydra takes 50 damage. If it loses 5 heads, it is also {@condition stunned} for one turn. If it loses 7 heads, it becomes vulnerable to all damage except poison.
For every 2 heads lost, the hydra also loses one use of its Legendary Resistances and Legendary Actions.
At the end of its turn, the hydra grows two heads, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 50 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Mythic Regeneration (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the ancient hydra would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit points instead reset to 525 and it releases a wave of poisonous energy. Each creature within 60 feet of the hydra must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@dice 10d8}) poison damage and being {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and not being poisoned on a successful one. A creature poisoned in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Additionally, the hydra regrows all lost heads and regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. For the next hour, the hydra can use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section.
Award the party an additional 50,000 XP (100,000 XP total) for defeating the ancient hydra after its Mythic Regeneration trait activates.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks made with its bite.

trait.name: Venomous Blood
entries: When the hydra takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra can use its Frightful Presence and make as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the hydra's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hydra's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The hydra makes one attack with its bite or tail.

legendary.name: Move (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hydra moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Rampage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The hydra makes a bite attack against each creature within its reach (up to a maximum number of attacks equal to its current number of heads) and then makes a tail attack.

mythicHeader: If the hydra's Mythic Regeneration trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Venomous Maw
entries: The hydra makes one bite attack, dealing an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a hit.

mythic.name: Toxic Cloud (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hydra exhales a poisonous cloud in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage and being {@condition poisoned} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not being {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.

mythic.name: Regenerative Surge (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The hydra regrows one severed head, regaining 50 hit points. If the hydra has all its heads, it regains 100 hit points instead.

monster.name: Arae

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The arae's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks).
The arae can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Curse of Divine Retribution (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the arae would be reduced to 0 hit points, her current hit points instead reset to 140, she immediately uses her Curse of Retribution, and she regains one expended use of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the arae can now use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section for 1 hour.
Award the party an additional 33,000 XP (66,000 XP total) for defeating the arae after her Curse of Divine Retribution trait activates.

trait.name: Insight of Retribution
entries: The arae knows if she hears a lie and if a creature has been wronged or unjustly treated.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the arae fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Vengeance's Demand
entries: When the arae casts a spell or uses her Curse of Retribution against a target she was invoked to bring vengeance upon, the target must make the saving throw with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arae makes three eldritch blast attacks or two touch of despair attacks. She then uses her Curse of Retribution or casts a spell.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) force damage.

action.name: Touch of Despair
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage taken, and the arae regains hit points equal to this amount. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Curse of Retribution
entries: The arae curses a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed and suffer one of the following effects (of the arae's choice) for 1 minute. A cursed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Painful Agony
entries: The target experiences intense pain, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Confounding Delirium
entries: The target is confused as per the {@spell confusion} spell due to delirium.

action.name: Paralyzing Fear
entries: The target is {@condition frightened}. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target is also {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Curse of Silence
entries: The target is silenced, becoming unable to speak or cast spells that requires verbal components.

action.name: Curse of Despair
entries: The target is overwhelmed by despair, imposing disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Blinding Vengeance
entries: The target is {@condition blinded}, unable to see anything but visions of their own misdeeds.

action.name: Curse of Vulnerability
entries: The target becomes vulnerable to a damage type of the arae's choice. If the target has resistance or immunity to the selected damage type, it loses any resistance or immunity instead.

reaction.name: Curse of Aegis
entries: When a creature the arae can see within 60 feet of her makes an attack roll, the arae imposes disadvantage on that roll.

legendary.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: The arae makes one eldritch blast attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The arae magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary.name: Invoke Curse of Retribution (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The arae uses her Curse of Retribution.

mythicHeader: If the arae's Curse of Divine Retribution trait has activated in the last hour, she can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Seal of Vengeance (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The arae marks a creature she can see within 60 feet of her with a seal of vengeance. For the next minute, the marked creature takes an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage whenever it takes damage from any source, and the arae regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt in this way. A marked creature can make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the seal on a success.

mythic.name: Curse of Discord (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Arae targets up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet. The targets must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, each target regards all creatures it can see as enemies until the end of the Arae's next turn.

monster.name: Bronze Automaton

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The automaton is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: When the automaton is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The automaton has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The automaton's weapon attacks are magical and are considered +1 weapons.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: The automaton counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push or drag.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: The automaton cannot be surprised and does not need to sleep, eat, or breathe.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The automaton makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Heated Body {@recharge 5}
entries: The automaton heats its body to red-hot temperatures until the start of its next turn. Any creature that touches the automaton or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Defensive Matrix
entries: When the automaton is targeted by an attack or spell that requires an attack roll, it imposes disadvantage on that roll. To do so, the automaton must see the attacker.

monster.name: Bronze Colossus

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Bronze Reformation (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the colossus would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit points instead reset to 325, as its enchanted bronze exterior rapidly repairs itself. During this process, the colossus emits a blinding flash of radiant energy in a 60-foot radius. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or take 52 ({@dice 8d12}) radiant damage and be blinded for 1 minute. Additionally, the colossus can now use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section for 1 hour.
Award the party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the colossus after its Bronze Reformation trait activates.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: When the colossus is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The colossus' weapon attacks are magical and are considered +2 weapons.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: The colossus cannot be surprised and does not need to sleep, eat, or breathe.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Titanic Might
entries: The colossus has advantage on all Strength ability checks and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The colossus makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d10 + 12}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 26}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the colossus can't use its slam attack.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} automatic hit, reach 10 ft., one {@condition grappled} target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d10 + 12}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 4d12 + 12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ground Quake {@recharge 5}
entries: The colossus strikes the ground with enormous force, causing the earth to tremor.

Each creature on the ground within 60 feet of the colossus must make a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes half damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Heated Body {@recharge 5}
entries: The colossus heats its body to red-hot temperatures until the start of its next turn. Any creature that touches the colossus or hits it with a melee attack takes 17 ({@dice 5d6}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The colossus makes one slam or crush attack.

legendary.name: Move (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The colossus moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Ground Quake (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The colossus immediately uses its Ground Quake action.

mythicHeader: If the colossus' Bronze Reformation trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Spear Attack
entries: The colossus makes one spear attack.

mythic.name: Heated Body (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The colossus immediately recharges and uses its Heated Body bonus action.

mythic.name: Earthquake (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The colossus immediately recharges and uses its Ground Quake action.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Calydonian boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the Calydonian boar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If damage reduces the Calydonian boar to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the Calydonian boar to 1 hit point instead and immediately makes one attack with its tusks.

trait.name: Terrifying Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Calydonian boar and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Calydonian boar makes two attacks: one with its tusks and one with its trample.

action.name: Tusks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Trample
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Trample Attack
entries: The Calydonian boar makes one trample attack.

legendary.name: Ferocious Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Calydonian boar moves up to its speed in a straight line towards an enemy creature and then makes one attack with its tusks.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Forest Concealment
entries: The centaur has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in forest terrain.

trait.name: Keen Tracker
entries: The centaur has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to follow tracks or detect hidden creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves or two with its longbow.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The centaur has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised in the first round of combat.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Forest Concealment
entries: The centaur has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in forest terrain.

trait.name: Keen Tracker
entries: The centaur has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to follow tracks or detect hidden creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves or two with its longbow.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The centaur is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The centaur has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Nature's Blessing
entries: The centaur and its allies within 30 feet have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves. Alternatively, it makes one attack and casts one spell with its Spellcasting trait.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Wild Shape (2/Day)
entries: The centaur magically assumes the shape of a beast that it has seen before with a challenge rating of 1 or lower for 1 hour. The druid reverts to its normal form earlier by using a bonus action or if it fall {@condition unconscious} or drops to 0 hit points. While transformed, its game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but the druid retains its alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the centaur hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The centaur warlord rerolls a failed saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur warlord makes three attacks: two with its pike and one with its hooves.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Commanding Presence {@recharge 5}
entries: The centaur warlord chooses up to three creatures within 30 feet of it. The chosen creatures gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throws until the start of the warlord's next turn.

legendary.name: Hooves
entries: The centaur warlord makes one attack with its hooves.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The centaur warlord moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Commanding Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The centaur warlord lets out a powerful roar. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet that can hear the roar must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of combat, the cerastes has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Sand Camouflage
entries: The cerastes has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cerastes makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its horns. The cerastes can replace its horn attack with a constrict attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage at the start of each turn. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. While grappling a target, the cerastes can't constrict another target.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The spawn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Three-Headed
entries: The spawn has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The spawn has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the spawn's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn makes three attacks with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@dice 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Rampage
entries: When the spawn reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, it can move up to half its speed towards an enemy and make an attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The spawn moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The spawn makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check with advantage.

legendary.name: Claw Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spawn makes one attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Fearsome Bark (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spawn lets out a fearsome bark. Each creature within 60 feet of the spawn that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Cerberus

trait.name: Eternal Vigilance
entries: Cerberus has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

trait.name: Three-Headed
entries: Cerberus has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Cerberus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of Cerberus' allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Guardian's Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When Cerberus would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit points instead resets to 175, it moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one bite attack, and it regains one expended use of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, Cerberus can now use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section for 1 hour.
Award the party an additional 33,000 XP (66,000 XP total) for defeating Cerberus after its Guardian's Wrath trait activates.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cerberus makes three attacks with its bite and one attack with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Rampage
entries: When Cerberus reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, it can move up to half its speed towards an enemy and make an attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Cerberus moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Cerberus makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Claw Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Cerberus makes one attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Baleful Bark (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Cerberus lets out a baleful bark. Each creature within 120 feet of Cerberus that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

mythicHeader: If Cerberus' Guardian's Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Cerberus makes one attack with its bite.

mythic.name: Infernal Blaze (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Cerberus exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@dice 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Innate Trickery
entries: The cercopes can cast the {@spell minor illusion} spell at will without requiring any material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}).

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Mischief {@recharge 5}
entries: The cercopes targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} with laughter until the end of its next turn. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isn't affected.

reaction.name: Evasive
entries: The cercopes can add 3 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the cercopes must see the attacker.

monster.name: Cetus
languages: understands Aquan and Common but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cetus' innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cetus can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cetus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Ocean's Fury (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the cetus would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit points instead reset to 175, it immediately recharges and uses its Tidal Charge, and it regains one expended use of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the cetus can now use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section for 1 hour.
Award the party an additional 22,000 XP (44,000 XP total) for defeating the cetus after its Ocean's Fury trait activates.

trait.name: Poseidon Blessing
entries: The cetus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Additionally, the cetus regenerates 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it is submerged in water and it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The cetus deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sonar Sense
entries: The cetus has blindsight out to a range of 120ft while fully submerged in water. The cetus can't use this sense while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Terrifying Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the cetus and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, rolling with disadvantage if the cetus is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cetus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can replace the bite with its Devour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}).
Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the cetus can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the cetus. {@h}The target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the cetus, and it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the cetus' turns. If the cetus takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the cetus must succeed on a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to half the damage taken (rounded up) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the cetus. If the cetus dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tidal Charge {@recharge 4}
entries: The cetus charges in a straight line up to 80 feet while underwater. Each creature in its path must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The cetus moves up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cetus makes one tail swipe attack.

legendary.name: Devour (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The cetus makes a devour attack.

mythicHeader: If the cetus' Ocean's Fury trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Tidal Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cetus uses its Tidal Charge.

mythic.name: Whirlpool Maelstrom (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The cetus creates a whirlpool in a 60-foot radius centered on itself. Creatures in that area must make a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also pulled 15 feet towards the cetus and is {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera cub makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Puff {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera cub exhales a burst of fire in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@dice 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Frenzied Onslaught (Recharges after a Short or a Long Rest)
entries: When the ancient chimera is reduced to or below 128 hit points, it enters a frenzied state for 1 hour.
