reaction.name: Pharaoh's Guard
entries: When the Medjay captain is within 5 feet of the Pharaoh and the Pharaoh takes damage from an attack targeting only it, the captain intercepts the attack, taking the damage instead of the Pharaoh.

reaction.name: Countermand
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Medjay captain targets a creature, the captain imposes disadvantage on that attack roll.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Carrying Capacity
entries: 2 Medium creatures & 400lb cargo

trait.name: Half Speed on Damaged Camel
entries: If a War Camel pulling the War Chariot dies, its speed is reduced by half. If both War Camels die, the War Chariot can't move.
Action Stations

trait.name: Mishaps
entries: If the War Chariot takes more than 20 damage from a single source if suffers a mishap. Roll on the {@table War Chariot Mishaps|MythologicalCreatures} table to determine what goes wrong.

action.name: Rapid Fire Arrows (Requires Archer Position)
entries: {@atk rw} +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft. The archer makes two attacks in quick succession. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage per arrow.

action.name: Helm (Requires 1 Crew)
entries: Drive and steer the War Chariot.

action.name: Archer Position (Requires 1 Crew)
entries: Use ranged weapons to attack from the chariot.

reaction.name: Quick Maneuver
entries: If the War Chariot is able to move, the driver can use its reaction to grant the War Chariot advantage on a Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Amphibious Adaptation
entries: The Petsuchos ignores difficult terrain in natural aquatic environments.

trait.name: Aquatic Ambush
entries: The Petsuchos has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide while submerged in water.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The Petsuchos can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Petsuchos has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the Petsuchos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Petsuchos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Petsuchos makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Petsuchos can't bite another target.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Predator Reflexes
entries: When a creature hits the Petsuchos with an attack, the petsuchos makes a tail swipe attack against the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Pharaoh is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The Pharaoh has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Command
entries: Allies within 10 feet of the Pharaoh gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws (already included in the Pharaoh's statblock).

trait.name: Divine Right
entries: The Pharaoh has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pharaoh makes two scepter attacks.

action.name: Scepter of the Pharaoh
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant or necrotic damage.

action.name: Commanding Presence {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pharaoh targets up to two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command given by the Pharaoh on its next turn as per the {@spell command} spell.

action.name: Divine Retribution (1/Day)
entries: The Pharaoh unleashes divine energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant or necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Blessing of the Gods
entries: The Pharaoh blesses one ally it can see within 30 feet of it, granting it 7 ({@dice 2d6}) temporary hit points and advantage on its next attack roll or saving throw.

reaction.name: Royal Decree
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the Pharaoh attacks, the Pharaoh imposes disadvantage on that roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The High Pharaoh is a 13th-level spellcaster.
Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The High Pharaoh has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Majesty
entries: Allies within 15 feet of the High Pharaoh gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws (already included in the Pharaoh's statblock).

trait.name: Divine Right
entries: The High Pharaoh has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the High Pharaoh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The High Pharaoh makes two scepter attacks.
The Pharaoh can replace one attack to cast a spell or use its Commanding Presence.

action.name: Scepter of the High Pharaoh
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant or necrotic damage.

action.name: Commanding Presence {@recharge 5}
entries: The High Pharaoh targets up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it.
Each target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command given by the Pharaoh on its next turn as per the {@spell command} spell.

action.name: Divine Retribution (2/Day)
entries: The High Pharaoh unleashes divine energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant or necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Blessing of the Gods
entries: The High Pharaoh blesses one ally it can see within 30 feet of it, granting it 10 ({@dice 3d6}) temporary hit points and advantage on its next attack roll or saving throw.

reaction.name: High Royal Decree
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the High Pharaoh attacks, the Pharaoh imposes disadvantage on that roll and uses its sacred flame spell against it.

monster.name: Supreme Pharaoh

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Supreme Pharaoh is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The Pharaoh has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Dominion
entries: Allies within 20 feet of the Supreme Pharaoh gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws (already included in the Pharaoh's statblock).

trait.name: Divine Ascension (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the Supreme Pharaoh is reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit points instead reset to 125, and it enters a state of Divine Ascension for 1 hour. In this state, the Supreme Pharaoh gains advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws. It also gains access to its {@b Mythic Actions}.
Award a party an additional an additional 13,000 XP (26,000 XP total) for defeating the Pharaoh after Divine Ascension activates grants.

trait.name: Divine Right
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Supreme Pharaoh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh makes three scepter attacks. The Pharaoh can replace one attack to cast a spell or use its Commanding Presence.

action.name: Scepter of the Supreme Pharaoh
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant or necrotic damage.

action.name: Commanding Presence {@recharge 5}
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh targets up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command given by the Pharaoh on its next turn as per the {@spell command} spell.

action.name: Divine Retribution (3/Day)
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh unleashes divine energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) radiant or necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Blessing of the Gods
entries: The High Pharaoh blesses one ally it can see within 30 feet of it, granting it 14 ({@dice 4d6}) temporary hit points and advantage on its next attack roll or saving throw.

reaction.name: Pharaoh's Decree
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the Supreme Pharaoh attacks, the Pharaoh imposes disadvantage on that roll and uses its sacred flame or {@spell command} spell against it.

legendary.name: Scepter Strike
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh makes one scepter attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell. (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh casts a spell up to 5th-level.

legendary.name: Divine Command (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh uses its Commanding Presence.

mythicHeader: If the Supreme Pharaoh's Divine Ascension trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Ancestral Judgment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh calls upon the power of its predecessors to smite foes. It targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) radiant or necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

mythic.name: Wrath of the Nile (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh unleashes the fury of the Nile in a 30-foot radius centered on a point it can see within 90 feet. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) bludgeoning damage be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not be knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

mythic.name: Sands of Time (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Supreme Pharaoh manipulates the flow of time within a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in this area other than the Pharaoh must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is slowed (as per the {@spell slow} spell) for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@dice 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@dice 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The phoenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Radiating Presence
entries: The phoenix sheds bright light in a 30- foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Each creature that starts its turn in the bright light must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: Upon death, the phoenix turns to ash. After {@dice 1d4} days, it is reborn from the ashes with all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phoenix makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

monster.name: Phoenix
languages: understands all languages but it can't speak

trait.name: Blazing Rebirth (Recharges after a Short or a Long Rest)
entries: When the phoenix is reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit points instead reset to 145, it regains one expended use of Legendary Resistance, and it explodes in a burst of scorching flames. Each creature within 60 feet of the phoenix must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, the phoenix can now use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section for 1 hour.
Award a party an additional 15,000 XP (30,000 XP total) for defeating the phoenix after its Blazing Rebirth trait activates.

entries: Whenever the phoenix is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The phoenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries: The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 16 ({@dice 3d10}) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 16 ({@dice 3d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The phoenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Legendary Resistances (3/Day)
entries: If the phoenix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The phoenix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The phoenix's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Radiating Presence
entries: The phoenix sheds bright light in a 60- foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Each creature that starts its turn in the bright light must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The phoenix regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: Upon death, the phoenix turns to ash. After {@dice 1d4} days, it is reborn from the ashes with all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phoenix makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 1d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@dice 6d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage plus 21 ({@dice 6d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The phoenix exhales fire in a 90- foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 ({@dice 16d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Blazing Flame
entries: When the phoenix is damaged by a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it, it unleashes a powerful flame back at the attacker. The target must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@dice 4d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Beak Attack
entries: The phoenix makes one attack with its beak.

legendary.name: Move (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The phoenix moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Fiery Breath (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The phoenix uses its Fiery Breath.

legendary.name: Flame Surge (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The phoenix unleash a burst of flames. Each creature within 30 feet of the phoenix must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@dice 8d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

mythicHeader: If the phoenix's Blazing Rebirth trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Talons Attack
entries: The phoenix makes one attack with its talons.

mythic.name: Blazing Speed
entries: The phoenix moves up to its speed.

mythic.name: Blazing Regeneration (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The phoenix regains 55 ({@dice 10d10}) hit points as fire mends its wounds.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The roc has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The young roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the young roc can't use its talons on another target.

action.name: Frightful Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The young roc emits a frightful screech. Each creature within 60 feet of the roc must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Additionally, any creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is also {@condition deafened} for the same duration. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the roc dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a beak attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 33 ({@damage 6d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The roc has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the roc fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The roc deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage. The target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the roc can't use one of its two talons on another target.

action.name: Terrifying Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The ancient roc emits a terrifying screech. Each creature within 120 feet of the roc must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way also has its movement speed reduced to 0. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Keen Detect
entries: The roc makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check with advantage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The roc moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Talons Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The roc makes one attack with its talons.

legendary.name: Dive Attack (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The roc moves up to its speed and then makes one beak attack.

legendary.name: Terrifying Screech (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The roc uses its Terrifying Screech.

trait.name: Sand Camouflage
entries: The elemental has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in sandy or desert environments.

trait.name: Sand Form
entries: The elemental can burrow through sand, loose earth, and nonmagical terrain without disturbing it and without leaving any trace of its passage.

trait.name: Sandstorm Aura
entries: The area within 10 feet of the elemental is heavily obscured for creatures other than the elemental.
Creatures starting their turn in the aura take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage from the abrasive sand.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sand Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental exhales a blast of scorching sand in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The sand blast leaves a layer of coarse sand in the area, turning it into difficult terrain for every creature other than the elemental for 1 minute.

trait.name: Solar Resilience
entries: The scarab beetle has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The scarab beetle can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and sand without disturbing the material it moves through.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Solar Resilience
entries: The giant scarab has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The giant scarab can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and sand without disturbing the material it moves through.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trample {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Serpopard's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The Serpopard can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Serpopard has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Serpopard moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the Serpopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Serpopard uses its Serpentine Gaze and then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Serpentine Gaze {@recharge 4}
entries: The Serpopard targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the Serpopard, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the Serpopard is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Unnerving Slink
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the Serpopard or enters this radius, the Serpopard forces the creature to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw if the Serpopard can see the target. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Sobek

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sobek's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 24}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious Sovereign
entries: Sobek can breathe both air and water. He effortlessly navigates through water, ignoring difficult terrain caused by water or water surfaces.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Sobek fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Nile's Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When Sobek is reduced to 0 hit points his current hit points instead reset to 290, he recharges his Flood ability, and regains 2 expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Sobek can use the {@b Mythic Actions} for the duration of 1 hour.
Award a party an additional 75,000 XP (150,000 XP total) for defeating Sobek after his Nile's Wrath trait activates.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Sobek regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Water Lord
entries: While underwater, Sobek has advantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sobek makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 25}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Sobek can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 3d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Flood {@recharge 5}
entries: Sobek unleashes a wave of water in a 120-foot line that is 30 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is pushed up to 30 feet away from Sobek, and on a successful save, it is pushed up to 15 feet away.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Sobek moves up to half his speed.

legendary.name: Tail Sweep (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sobek makes a tail attack against each creature of his choice within reach, rolling a separate attack roll for each target.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sobek casts a spell with his Innate Spellcasting trait.

legendary.name: Flood (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Sobek uses his Flood.

mythicHeader: If Sobek's Nile's Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, he can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Claw Attack
entries: Sobek makes one claw attack.

mythic.name: Crushing Waters (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sobek causes the water in a 60-foot radius around him to swirl violently. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

mythic.name: Mighty Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sobek emits a powerful roar.

All creatures that can hear within 120 feet of him must make a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if Sobek is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

mythic.name: Devouring Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Sobek makes one bite attack against a creature he is grappling. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage, and Sobek regains hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

trait.name: Sobek Blessing
entries: The Sobek crocodile has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Additionally, the crocodile naturally regenerates 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it is submerged in water and it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The Sobek crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sobek crocodile makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Sobek crocodile can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sacred Fury {@recharge 5}
entries: The Sobek crocodile channels its divine wrath. It makes one bite and one tail attack with a +2 bonus on the attack roll. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Uraeus' spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Uraeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Uraeus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Uraeus can't constrict another target.

reaction.name: Guardian of the Pharaoh
entries: When the Pharaoh is attacked, the Uraeus imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Constrict Attack
entries: The Uraeus makes one constrict attack.

legendary.name: Venomous Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Uraeus makes one bite attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Wadjet

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Wadjet's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Wadjet knows if she hears a lie.

trait.name: Divine Protector (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Wadjet is reduced to 0 hit points, her current hit points instead reset to 195 and she releases a blinding light. All hostile creatures within 120 feet must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of their next turn. Additionally, Wadjet can now use the options in the {@b Mythic Actions} section for 1 hour.
Award a party an additional 25,000 XP (50,000 XP total) for defeating Wadjet after her Divine Protector trait activates.

trait.name: Goddess of Protection
entries: Wadjet can cast the {@spell shield} spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, when she casts a spell, she gains a +1 to her AC until the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Wadjet fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Wadjet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regal Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of Wadjet and is aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Wadjet makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Divine Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: Wadjet unleashes a gaze of divine power in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Wadjet makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Wadjet casts a spell with her Innate Spellcasting trait.

legendary.name: Healing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Wadjet touches another creature with healing energy. The target magically regains 27 ({@dice 6d8}) hit points.

legendary.name: Divine Gaze (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Wadjet uses her Divine Gaze.

mythicHeader: If Wadjet's Divine Protector trait has activated in the last hour, she can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite Attack
entries: Wadjet makes one bite attack.

mythic.name: Benediction of the Nile (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Wadjet invokes the sanctity of the Nile, casting a blessing on allies within 60 feet. Each creature of her choice gains 20 temporary hit points and advantage on its next attack roll or saving throw.

mythic.name: Wrath of the Uraeus (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Wadjet's uraeus symbol comes to life, spewing divine fire in a 90-foot cone.

Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@dice 6d10}) fire damage and 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The bunyip has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised in the first round of combat.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bunyip can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The bunyip can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bunyip has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the bunyip remains motionless and submerged in water, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary floating log or foliage and it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bunyip makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The bunyip makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the bunyip, and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the bunyip's turns. If the bunyip takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the bunyip must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the bunyip. If the bunyip dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The gallu's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The gallu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The gallu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gallu makes two attacks with its greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Grasp of the Underworld (1/Day)
entries: The gallu targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by shadowy tendrils for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check, freeing itself on a success. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Necrotic Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Terrifying Visage {@recharge}
entries: The gallu unleashes an aura of fear. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The gallu's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks).
The gallu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aura of Command
entries: Allied fiends within 60 feet of the gallu have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage with their weapon attacks (already included in the gallu's statblock).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The gallu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gallu makes two attacks with its greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Grasp of the Underworld (3/Day)
entries: The gallu targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by shadowy tendrils for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check, freeing itself on a success. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

bonus.name: Terrifying Visage {@recharge 5}
entries: The gallu unleashes an aura of fear. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Shadowstep
entries: The gallu magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Darkened Resilience
entries: When the gallu takes damage, it enshrouds itself in darkness, halving the damage taken.

legendary.name: Greatsword Attack
entries: The gallu makes one greatsword attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The gallu magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Shadow Bolt (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The gallu makes a Shadow Bolt attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The jengu is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The jengu has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jengu can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aquatic Empathy
entries: The jengu can communicate with aquatic creatures and has advantage on ability checks to influence them.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The jengu touches another creature.
The target magically regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points and is freed from any blindness, deafness, and disease affecting it.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Blessing (1/Day)
entries: The jengu blesses a nearby body of water. A creature that drinks this water gains 6 temporary hit points. The water remains blessed for 1 hour, after which it loses its blessing effect.

reaction.name: Flowing Defense
entries: When hit by an attack, the jengu adds 2 to its AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The jengu priestess is a 5th-level spellcaster.
Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The jengu has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jengu can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aquatic Empathy
entries: The jengu can communicate with aquatic creatures and has advantage on ability checks to influence them.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The jengu touches another creature.
The target magically regains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hit points and is freed from any blindness, deafness, and disease affecting it.

action.name: Water Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Blessing (2/Day)
entries: The jengu blesses a nearby body of water. A creature that drinks this water gains 10 temporary hit points. The water remains blessed for 1 hour, after which it loses its blessing effect.

reaction.name: Flowing Defense
entries: When hit by an attack, the jengu adds 3 to her AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The jengu high priestess is a 9th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The jengu has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jengu can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aquatic Empathy
entries: The jengu can communicate with aquatic creatures and has advantage on ability checks to influence them.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The jengu touches another creature.
The target magically regains 21 ({@dice 6d8}) hit points and is freed from any blindness, deafness, and disease affecting it.

action.name: Water Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Blessing (3/Day)
entries: The jengu blesses a nearby body of water. A creature that drinks this water gains 15 temporary hit points. The water remains blessed for 1 hour, after which it loses its blessing effect.

action.name: Ocean's Wrath {@recharge 5}
entries: The jengu summons a powerful wave in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Flowing Defense
entries: When hit by an attack, the jengu adds 5 to her AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

trait.name: Charm Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of La Dame aux Glaïeuls must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way must move towards La Dame using the shortest and most direct route. This effect ends if the creature takes damage. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to La Dame's Charm Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: La Dame aux Glaïeuls can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when she is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: La Dame aux Glaïeuls can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: La Dame aux Glaïeuls makes two attacks: one with her bouquet and one with her claws.

action.name: Bouquet of Gladioli
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Enthralling Bouquet {@recharge 5}
entries: La Dame aux Glaïeuls offers her bouquet to one {@condition charmed} creature within 5 feet of her. The target is compelled to accept the bouquet, becoming {@condition paralyzed} as long as it is {@condition charmed} or until a creature within 5 feet of the target takes an action to remove the bouquet from its hands. La Dame can immediately make a claw attack against any creature that accepts her bouquet.

bonus.name: Etherealness
entries: La Dame aux Glaïeuls enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Lu Nannorcu hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lu Nannorcu makes two attacks with its greatclub.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: Lu Nannorcu unleashes a terrifying roar. Each creature within 30 feet of Lu Nannorcu that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Lu Nannorcu's Frightful Roar for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Ninki Nanka regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The Ninki Nanka has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Wrath of the Swamp (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the Ninki Nanka is reduced to or below 86 hit points, it unleashes its wrath for 1 hour. For the duration, the Ninki Nanka's speed increases by 20 feet, and its Mystical Gaze is always charged. Additionally, the Ninki Nanka gains resistance to all damage and can make an extra bite attack as part of its Multiattack action. The Ninki Nanka's attacks also deal an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. Defeating the Ninki Nanka after its Wrath of the Swamp trait activates awards the party an additional 2,800 XP (10,000 XP total).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Ninki Nanka uses its Mystical Gaze and makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Mystical Gaze {@recharge 4}
entries: The Ninki Nanka targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Ninki Nanka moves up to half his speed.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ninki Nanka makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Ninki Nanka makes a tail attack.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Odontotyrannos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Odontotyrannos deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the Odontotyrannos moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Tusks of Terror
entries: The Odontotyrannos' gore attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Odontotyrannos makes two attacks with its gore and one with its stomp.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thunderous Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The Odontotyrannos lets out a thunderous roar in a 120-foot radius. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it is within line of sight of the Odontotyrannos, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Odontotyrannos moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Odontotyrannos makes one attack with its gore or its stomp.

legendary.name: Charge (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Odontotyrannos moves up to its speed towards an enemy it can see and makes a gore attack at the end of this movement.

trait.name: Asexual Reproduction (1/Day)
entries: Progenitus can create {@dice 1d4 + 1} Monstrosities of CR 5 or lower in 1 hour. These creatures are loyal to Progenitus and follow its commands.

trait.name: Divine Ancestry
entries: Progenitus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Progenitus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Progenitus can take one reaction per turn.
Additionally, it has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition deafened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Worshiper's Boon
entries: For every 50,000 worshipers it has, Progenitus gains a +1 bonus to all attack rolls and saving throw DCs, up to a maximum of +3.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Progenitus can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spiked Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Progenitus' choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if Progenitus is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Progenitus' Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Elemental Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: Progenitus breaths elemental energy in a 90-foot cone or a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The damage type is chosen by Progenitus from the following list: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Progenitus makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Progenitus moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Spiked Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Progenitus makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Summon Monstrosity (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Progenitus summons a Monstrosity of its choice up to a CR of 5. The summoned creature obey Progenitus' commands and lasts for 1 hour or until it drops to 0 hit points. Progenitus can have a maximum of 3 creatures summoned in this way.

legendary.name: Breath of Chaos (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Progenitus uses its Elemental Breath.

_versions.name: Progenitus, Progenitor of All Monsters (10,000+ Worshippers)

If Progenitus has a certain amount of worshipers, it can use the following options as legendary actions.

entries: Progenitus issues a compelling command to one creature it can see. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn as per the {@spell command} spell.

action.name: Summon Scorpion (3/Day)
entries: The scorpion man summons a giant scorpion in a point it can see within 60 feet. The giant scorpion acts on its own initiative and obeys the scorpion man's command.

bonus.name: Royal Command
entries: The scorpion man issues a command to up to 3 allied scorpion men or scorpion-like creatures within 60 feet of it that can hear the command. These allies can use their reaction to immediately make an attack.

monster.name: Tikoloshe
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The tikoloshe's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
will: {@spell create or destroy water} (destroy water only)

trait.name: Water Bound
entries: The tikoloshe must make contact with water at least once every 24 hours. If it fails to do so, it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage every hour after the 24th until it submerges in water. This damage can't be reduced by any means.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The tikoloshe turns {@condition invisible}. It remains {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell.

action.name: Terrifying Visage {@recharge 4}
entries: The tikoloshe targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Mischievous Trick (3/Day)
entries: The tikoloshe preforms a minor magical trick within 60 feet to cause confusion or fear, such as creating a small illusion, making a strange noise, or moving a small object. The effect is harmless and lasts for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Startling Vanish
entries: When the tikoloshe takes damage, it uses its Invisibility and moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werehyena has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Night Stalker
entries: While in darkness or dim light, the werehyena's speed increases by 10 feet and it gains advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werehyena can use its action to polymorph into a hyena-humanoid hybrid or into a hyena, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In hyena form, the werehyena makes two bite attacks. In humanoid form, it makes two club attacks. In hybrid form, it can make any two attacks.

action.name: Bite (Hyena or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werehyena lycanthropy.

action.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Club (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Bloodscent
entries: When the werehyena deals damage to a creature, it gains advantage on its next attack roll against that creature made during the next minute.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The werewolf alpha has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The werewolf alpha regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the werewolf takes damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the its next turn. The werewolf dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werewolf alpha can use its bonus action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its humanoid form. Its statistics remain the same in each form, while any equipment it is wearing isn't transformed. The werewolf reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The werewolf alpha makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. While in its humanoid form, the werewolf replaces any claws attacks with a longsword attack instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claws (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Pack Leader (1/Day)
entries: The werewolf alpha magically calls {@dice 1d4 + 1} dire wolves or 1 werewolf for assistance. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the werewolf and obeying its spoken commands. These creatures remain for 1 hour, until the werewolf dies, or until the werewolf dismisses them as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Savage Retaliation (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: When the werewolf alpha takes damage from a creature within 5 feet of it, it makes one claw attack against the attacker. If the attack hits, the werewolf can move up to half its speed towards an enemy it can see.

monsterFluff.name: Aeternae
entries: The {@b Aeternae} were mysterious creatures from Greek mythology, distinctive for their unique and fearsome anatomy: their humanoid bodies were covered in sharp, bony spikes, which they could launch at their enemies. These spikes served both defensive and offensive purposes, rendering the {@b Aeternae} formidable adversaries in combat.

The origins of the {@b Aeternae} are veiled in the depths of mythological history, with their tales often interwoven with the narratives of gods and heroes. One of the most notable legends recounts the {@b Aeternae}'s engagement in battle against the forces of Dionysus during his expedition to India. In this tale, they proved to be daunting foes, inflicting severe losses on Dionysus' army. Reports regarding the {@b Aeternae} can also be found in the historical accounts of Alexander the Great's conquests. As the Macedonian king ventured into the vast expanses of the known world, he encountered many wonders and challenges, including these mysterious creatures. Historical records and ancient writings provide glimpses of Alexander's encounters with these mythical beings. Arrian, a second-century historian and one of the primary sources on Alexander the Great, documented the Macedonian king's travels and battles in his work

In conclusion, the involvement of the Aerternae in the campaigns of Dionysus and Alexander the Great is often interpreted allegorically, representing the unforeseen challenges that even deities and heroes might encounter in their quests.

table.name: Progenitus Creature Adaptations
intro: The Adaptation Table provided in this page is used to determine mutations for creatures under the influence of Progenitus, when they are summoned, spawned, or first enter its domain. Alternatively, it can also be adapted for use with monstrosities warped by powerful magic or other means, providing a versatile tool for enhancing a variety of beings with unique mutations, always keeping your encounters fresh. Each mutation is designed to enhance a creature's capabilities in unique ways, affecting its abilities, appearance, and combat strategies.
table.caption: Use the table to determine how a creature mutates when under the influence of Progenitus.
rows: The creature's skin hardens into a shell, increasing its AC by 2.
Grows venomous fangs, adding 4 (1d8) poison damage to bite attacks.
Sprouts leathery wings, gaining a flying speed of 60 ft., or increasing its flying speed by 30 ft.
Grows two additional limbs, granting an extra claw attack during its turn.
Gains fast healing, regaining 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.
The creature's eyes become imbued with magic, granting the ability to see through magical darkness out to a range of 120 ft.
Grows tentacles, increasing the reach of its melee weapon attacks by 10 ft.

Gains a 30-foot cone breath weapon once per short rest as an action. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (determined randomly) on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Muscles bulge with power, increasing the creature's Strength score by 2, up to a maximum of 30.
Develops a mental shield, gaining advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The creature's skin matches its surroundings, granting advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

Can emit a powerful screech once per short rest as an action. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
The creature's weapon attacks become magical.
Emits toxic spores. Each other creature starting its turn within 5 ft. of the monstrosity must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.
Radiates decay in a 10-ft radius, dealing 3 (1d6) necrotic damage to creatures entering or starting their turn in it.
The creature gains 50 current and maximum hit points.
Gains truesight out to a range of 30 ft.
Becomes more flexible, gaining advantage on Dexterity ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.
Gains telepathy out to a range of 120 ft.
Can teleport up to 30 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see as a bonus action.

table.name: War Chariot Mishaps
intro: The War Chariot represents a significant advancement in ancient warfare, particularly utilized by the Medjay Guards and, on rare occasions, by Egyptian Nomads. Constructed with a sturdy wooden body reinforced with metal, it is designed to withstand the rigors of combat while providing a mobile platform for archers. Pulled by two powerful War Camels, the chariot boasts an impressive speed, allowing for rapid movement across the battlefield.
table.caption: Use the table to determine what mishap occours to a War Chariot
rows: {@b Broken Axle:} One of the chariot's axles snaps, causing it to lurch violently. The chariot's speed is halved, and it cannot make sharp turns until repaired.

{@b Wheel Damage:} A wheel of the chariot is damaged, making steering difficult. The driver must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity check at the start of its turn to maintain control. On a failure, the chariot veers off in a random direction.

{@b Reins Snapped:} The reins used to control the War Camel snap. The driver loses control of the chariot, which continues moving in a straight line and cannot change direction or speed until the reins are fixed.

{@b Camel Panic:} One of the war camels panics, making it unruly. The chariot behaves erratically, moving in a random direction at half speed each turn until the camel is calmed with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Animal Handling) check.
